payload.text: What documentation should I provide when filing a dispute?
payload.answer: When filing a dispute, provide account statements, payment receipts, relevant communication history, loan agreement copies, and any other documents that directly support your dispute claim for efficient investigation and resolution [74][69].

payload.text: How do I qualify for the financial hardship program?

payload.text: What should I do if I feel a recovery agent is using inappropriate methods?

payload.text: Will restructuring my loan affect my credit score?

payload.text: What does it mean if my account is marked as 'delinquent'?
payload.answer: An account marked 'delinquent' means you have missed one or more payments past the due date, which may result in late fees, negative credit reporting after 30 days, and escalating collection activities if the delinquency continues [67][59].

payload.text: Are there regulations about how often I can be contacted?
payload.answer: Yes, RBI regulations require that contact attempts be reasonable in frequency, avoiding harassment through excessive calls or visits, with industry standards generally limiting contact to 3-4 attempts per week unless otherwise agreed [59][60].

payload.text: What are the guidelines for recovery agents contacting borrowers?
payload.answer: Recovery agents must follow strict RBI guidelines including contacting borrowers only between 8 AM and 7 PM, using respectful language, maintaining privacy, avoiding harassment or intimidation, and clearly identifying themselves and their purpose [59][60].

payload.text: Can I make a partial payment towards my overdue amount?
payload.answer: Yes, you can make a partial payment towards your overdue amount, though it's important to discuss this with our collection support team first to understand how it will affect your account status and to establish a plan for the remaining balance [69][67].

payload.text: What information can recovery agents discuss with family members?
payload.answer: Recovery agents are prohibited from discussing your loan details with family members without your consent, and can only confirm your identity or leave callback requests without revealing the purpose of their visit or any account information [59][60].

payload.text: Can recovery agents visit my home or workplace?
payload.answer: Recovery agents may visit your home with prior appointment during reasonable hours (8 AM to 7 PM), but workplace visits are generally discouraged and only conducted with discretion in exceptional circumstances, always respecting privacy and dignity [59][60].

payload.text: What options do I have if I've lost my job and can't make payments?

payload.text: What topics are covered in financial counseling sessions?
payload.answer: Financial counseling sessions cover budget creation and management, expense prioritization, debt reduction strategies, income maximization opportunities, government assistance programs, credit rebuilding techniques, and development of long-term financial stability plans [51][54].

payload.text: How do I request a settlement offer on my overdue loan?

payload.text: What collection practices are prohibited by RBI guidelines?
payload.answer: RBI guidelines prohibit harassment, abusive language, threatening behavior, calling outside permitted hours (8 AM to 7 PM), contacting borrowers at inconvenient locations, revealing debt information to third parties, and using misleading statements during collection [59][60].

payload.text: Can I still access my regular account features while in collections?

payload.text: How long will a settlement offer remain valid?

payload.text: How does LenDenClub ensure compliance with collection regulations?

payload.text: Do I need to notarize any documents for collection processes?

payload.text: What types of payment plans are available for overdue accounts?

payload.text: How do I set up a payment arrangement for my overdue account?

payload.text: When does the collection process begin after a missed payment?

payload.text: How can financial counseling help me resolve my collection issues?
